entry.et: Middle English bisy, from Old English bisig; akin to Middle Dutch & Middle Low German besich busy

def.dt: :being in use found the telephone busy
:full of distracting detail a busy design

entry.pt: busy industrious diligent assiduous sedulous mean actively engaged or occupied. busy chiefly stresses activity as opposed to idleness or leisure too busy to spend time with the children. industrious implies characteristic or habitual devotion to work industrious employees. diligent suggests earnest application to some specific object or pursuit very diligent in her pursuit of a degree. assiduous stresses careful and unremitting application assiduous practice. sedulous implies painstaking and persevering application a sedulous investigation of the murder.

def.dt: :bustle small boats busied to and fro Quentin Crewe
